item.Name: do not re-use parts when looping#This option will hurt performance on effects with very short duration.
use parent position but world orientation
cannot be restarted#Will help performance for parallel events of different lengths, if the effect is unlikely to be reused
force use own lightprobe#Do not adopt parent object's lightprobe, even when it's available
force looping#Do not use this unless you know you stop the effect at some point
ordnance droppod locator#trigger creation of player's ordnance droppod
render in hologram pass#this effect should be lumped in with Cortana and other holograms when rendered
lightprobe only sample airprobes#Only works with
draw .parts when stopped{draw lens flares when stopped}
kill particles when stopped#particularly useful for particles that live forever
disable first person parts in blind skull#blind skull hides the first person weapon
hides associated object on effect deletion#when the effect is deleted, it hides the object it is associated with (for hologram in mp)
bypass mp throttle#effect can not ignore generated crates or be non-networked

_field_dword_integer.name: fixed random seed#If this is non-zero, the effect will usually be exactly repeatable

_field_string_id.name: scale A override#Handle with care. FYI only works if the effect is attached to an object
scale B override#Handle with care. FYI only works if the effect is attached to an object

_field_block.name: locations
_field_block._field_explanation:
In addition to the marker in the render model there are several special marker names:
replace Replace allows you to use the same effect with different markers. Damage transition effects support this for example.
gravity, up The direction of gravity (down) and the opposite direction (up). Always supplied
normal Vector pointing directly away from the surface you collided with. Supplied for effects from collision.
forward The 'negative incident' vector i.e. the direction the object is moving in. Most commonly used to generated decals. Supplied for effects from collision.
backward The 'incident' vector i.e. the opposite of the direction the object is moving in. Supplied for effects from collision.
reflection The way the effect would reflect off the surface it hit. Supplied for effects from collision.
root The object root (pivot). These can used for all effects which are associated with an object.
impact The location of a havok impact.
water_surface Point of the effect projected to the water surface above it. Otherwise it just returns the effect position.
child The location of the last detonated projectile, in case the parent object is a weapon (tracers only)

item.Name: track sub-frame movements#When effect moves multiple times within one frame, update location each time
never stagger across markers#Even if this effect is told to stagger across available markers, always fire from all instances

_field_block.name: events

item.Name: particles die when effect ends{particles die when event ends}

_field_real_fraction.name: skip fraction#chance that this event will be skipped entirely

_field_custom.name: delay bounds:seconds#delay before this event takes place

_field_real_bounds.name: delay bounds:seconds#delay before this event takes place

_field_block._field_explanation: Parts and particle systems can take "event age" as a function input. Typically that goes from 0 to 1 over the event duration. If you want a different time, specify it here. 0 means use the duration bounds above.

_field_real.name: event age duration override:seconds#the amount of time over which the "event age" function input goes from 0 to 1

item.Name: create even when event loops back to self
sound only plays in killcam#NOTE this is only for sound, and really only for firing effect sounds

_field_char_enum.name: camera mode#Currently, the only supported use is to turn parts off in first-person view.

_field_tag_reference.name: type^
_field_tag_reference.validtags: rwrd, jpt!, drdf, sndo, decs, lens, ligh, gldf, ltvl, sefc, char, cpem, obje, shit, cmoe, snd!, trac, airs

_field_custom.name: velocity bounds:world units per second#initial velocity along the location's forward, for decals the distance at which decal is created (defaults to 0.5)

_field_real_bounds.name: velocity bounds:world units per second#initial velocity along the location's forward, for decals the distance at which decal is created (defaults to 0.5)

_field_angle.name: velocity cone angle:degrees#initial velocity will be inside the cone defined by this angle.

_field_tag_reference.name: particleize#optional particleization effect definition, if you want this to particleize on spawn

_field_short_integer.name: sort bias#use values between -10 and 10 to move closer and farther from camera (positive is closer)

item.Name: particles continue as usual when offscreen{skip visibility test}{cinematics}
particles die when effect ends{die when orphaned}
use synchronized random seed#synchronized across particle systems
use world orientation#particle system uses local-space position but up is always 'global up'
render in spawn order#first particle spawned renders first (at the back), last particle spawned renders last (front)
dynamic particle resolution#use distance and multiplier (below) to tune high- or low-res rendering

_field_real_bounds.name: percent velocity to inherit#flag must be checked above

_field_real.name: size scale#multiplied by all "size" related fields, like scale, velocity, acceleration
camera offset:world units#the particle is pushed away from the camera this distance (can be negative)
near fade range:world units#distance beyond cutoff over which particles fade
near fade cutoff:world units#distance in front of camera where fade is complete*
near fade override:world units#distance in front of camera where fade is complete
far fade range:world units#distance before cutoff over which particles fade
far fade cutoff:world units#distance from camera where fade is complete
LOD feather out delta#0 defaults to 5.0, minimum is 0.0001

item.Name: volume emitter particle velocities are random#By default, particles emit radially away from the emitter center. This option gives them random velocity instead. This only applies to volume emitters.

_field_real.name: bounding radius estimate*:world units#used if override is zero
bounding radius override:world units#used if non-zero

_field_real_point_3d.name: axis scale#NOTE - setting this will break automatic bounding sphere calculation, you must enter radius manually

_field_struct.name: translational offset:world units#XYZ controls that offset the emitter's origin from the original location

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: relative direction#yaw/pitch that changes the initial rotation of the emitter

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: emission radius:world units#defines the size of the emitter

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: emission angle:degrees#determines the angle at which particles are emitted

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: emission axis angle:degrees#determines the max tilt for particle axis

particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: particle starting count#number of particles that are spawned at the birth of the effect

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: particle max count:0=unlimited#max number of particles allowed to exist at one time

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: particle emission rate:particles per second#number of particles that are spawned every second from the emitters

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: particle emission per distance:particles per world unit#number of particles that are spawned every world unit of motion from the emitters

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: particle lifespan:seconds#the number of seconds a particle will live after emission

particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_real.name: force strength#positive pushes out, negative pulls in
sphere falloff begin:wus#doesn't work on cylinders, due to shader constant constraints
sphere falloff end:wus#doesn't work on cylinders, due to shader constant constraints

_field_struct.name: particle self-acceleration:world units per second per second

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: particle initial velocity{particle velocity}:world units per second
